alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 16 at 3:19AM MDT until June 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 12 PM TO 9 PM SATURDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday. Between 6 and 12 hours of single digit relative humidity readings are expected in the Middle Rio Grande Valley with a few hours possible elsewhere. Gusty westerly to southwesterly winds are expected each afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...The Red Flag Warning includes the West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and Central Highlands (125) Friday afternoon and evening and this includes the same areas Saturday afternoon and evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph, except 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 across the Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
